71.heading: Ego Comme X--Miscellanea.
71.title: "L'Irrésistible Ascension de l'Édition Indépendante"
71.author: Jean-Philippe Martin
71.appears_in: p. 22-31 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: Begins: "Présents pour la première fois sur un même stand au Salon du Livre de Paris in 1999, une vingtaine de petits éditeurs francophones, comptant parmi les plus actifs comme Amok, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon et bien sûr l'Association, venaient prouver du haut de leurs 500 ouvrages publiés en l'espace de 10 ans, qu'au-delà des plus folles espérances, un véritable renouveau de la bande dessinée de création avait trouvé à s'incarner. Un dossier tirant le bilan des années 1990 exigeait que l'on revînt sur la montée en puissance de ce que l'on désigne souvent comme 'l'édition indépendante' (qu'il serait peut-être plus juste d'appeler, tout simplement, 'les petits éditeurs').

English summary (from p. 150): "The Irresistible Ascension of the Independent Publishers. Amok, the Association, La Cinquième couche, Cornélius, Ego comme X, Fréon, the Requins marteau, 6 Pieds sous Terre: these are some of the main independent publishers that have emerged during the last decade. Small organizations, often founded and run by creators, they maintain an uncompromising conception of creation and produce objects that are distinct from the traditional album. Their rise has been steady, as Jean-Philippe Martin shows. He predicts they will influence the future of comics in general."

"From the wilds of Persia to the pyramids of the Yucatan, Sheba's racking up the frequent flyer miles as Seth closes in on his target, a large striped box. But does the secret to thwarting this self-described 'ultimate evil' lie in the past, in the court of Egypt's final queen?"

129.heading: Egypt.
129.title: The Sands of Seth
129.author: written and illustrated by Walter S
notes: Most of the material was previously printed in the first seven issues of Sheba, 1996-1998.

"The tale of a dead cat. Sheba has been plastered in her tomb for centuries...her beloved Egypt has fallen into ruin under the spell of a trendy new religion...will the asinine ambitions of Seth trip up Sheba's plans for life after death after life?"

130.heading: Egypt.

130.author: by F

notes: Introduction of a villain named Vogel, and a character named Hassan.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

Egypt. "A Week with Shalmaneser-Minor ever so long (3000 years or so) ago, by our own Chaldeologist" p. 169 in The Boy's Own Paper, v. 17, no. 831 (Dec. 15, 1894).
Six captioned panels detail a week in an ancient Egyptian school.

138.author: [No author]

notes: SUMMARY: August Bocke drank a preparation made by Von Emmelman from heiroglypic instructions and is cursed with eternal life; Bocke searches the pyramids looking for the Book of the Dead; the Heap catches up with him in passageways under the Sphinx.
